result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Matthew John Johnson was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any AODA/counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription.  Not to go to taverns/bars or liquor stores except as required by/for employment.  Absolute Sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances.  Not to operate MV w/o valid DL and then only w/agent's prior consent.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Matthew John Johnson in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Parties discuss resolution.  Court notes these cases are not assigned to him and wants DE to agree that he can do the sentencing even though they are not his cases.  Atty VanWagner talks to DE off the record.  DE and Atty VanWagner agree.  State states recommendations.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver in 17CF26/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  State files information.  Atty VanWagner acknowledges rec. information in 17CF26/waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  NC pleas entered.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  DE advised re: voting rights, felony firearms and appeal rights.  State makes statement.  Atty VanWagner makes statement/notes DE waives his right to a PSI.  DE makes brief statement and agrees to waiver of PSI.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Parties to notify Court if any jail credit is due.
